intro: Tarennella sanguinea, commonly known as the red tarennella, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy appearance. Tarennella sanguinea is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
